subject: Parenting
title: Learning to Share
description: A short lesson to help you apply Learning to Share.

hook.text: A three-year-old clutches her toy and screams 'Mine!' Sharing isn't in her repertoire yet.

buildup.text: True sharing requires understanding that others have desires â€” a skill that develops slowly.

discovery.text: Before four, children can take turns when told but don't genuinely want to share.

twist.text: Forcing sharing early can increase possessiveness. Kids need ownership before generosity.

climax.text: By five, most children share voluntarily â€” especially with friends they want to keep.

punchline.text: You can't share until you understand 'mine.'

quiz.question: Why can't most three-year-olds truly share?
options: They haven't developed awareness of others' desires
